title: #15 Measure your Calibre
body:
{"type":"doc","content":[{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"Choose the correct Option","marks":[{"type":"bold"}]}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"I) If the linear momentum of a body is conserved then angular momentum is conserved about a point."}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"II) If the angular momentum of a body is conserved about a point then the linear momentum is conserved."}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"horizontalRule"},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"Other problems: "},{"type":"text","text":"Check your Calibre","marks":[{"attrs":{"href":"","target":"_blank"},"type":"link"}]}]}]}

discussion.body:
{"type":"doc","content":[{"type":"text","text":"
                                
                                
                                
                                    
                                        "},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"Simple linear momentum is conserved when a particle moves in a straight line so angular momentum will be conserved about any point.
But now consider circular motion so angular momentum will be conserved but linear momentum will change its direction every time"}]},{"type":"text","text":"

                                    
                                
                            "}]}

{"type":"doc","content":[{"type":"text","text":"
                                
                                
                                
                                    
                                        "},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"Both the statements are wrong ."}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"Consider a smooth rod placed on a horizontal surface."}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"If we apply forces at its two ends in same direction linear momentum wont be conserved but angular momentum will be conserved."}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"Similarly if they are applied in opposite directions then angular momentum wont be conserved but linear momentum will be conserved"}]},{"type":"text","text":"

                                    
                                
                            "}]}

title: #16 Measure your Calibre
body:
{"type":"doc","content":[{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"All the leters of the word SURITI are arranged in a dictionary. Find the rank of the word.
If rank is coming out "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"D"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":". Find "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"D+60 "}],"attrs":{"inline":true}}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"Details and Assumptions","marks":[{"type":"bold"}]}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"bulletList","content":[{"type":"listItem","content":[{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"Here rank means at what number the word comes in the dictionary made of all possible arrangements the letters of that particular word."}]}]},{"type":"listItem","content":[{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"Like a normal dictionary, the words are alphabetized from A to Z. "}]}]}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"horizontalRule"},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"Other problems: "},{"type":"text","text":"Check your Calibre","marks":[{"attrs":{"href":"","target":"_blank"},"type":"link"}]}]}]}

{"type":"doc","content":[{"type":"text","text":"
                                
                                    "},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"Relevant wiki: Rank of a Word in Dictionary","marks":[{"type":"italic"}]}]},{"type":"text","text":"

title: 15 points

discussion.body:
{"type":"doc","content":[{"type":"text","text":"
                                
                                
                                
                                    
                                        "},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"If we want to choose three points, we can do it
"},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"\binom{15}{3}=\dfrac{15*14*13}{1*2*3}=455"}],"attrs":{"inline":false}},{"type":"text","text":"
ways. The three points always define a triangle, except they are on the same line. There are three lines, and there are "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"6"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":" points in each of them. Since three points can't be on two lines at the same moment, from the "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"455"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":" ways
"},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"3*\binom{6}{3}=3*\dfrac{6*5*4}{1*2*3}=60"}],"attrs":{"inline":false}},{"type":"text","text":"
ways aren't make solutions. "}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"Therefore the answer is "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"455-60=\boxed{395}"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":"."}]},{"type":"text","text":"

                                    
                                
                            "}]}
